meanings.definition: A person who is regarded as despicable or treacherous.
meanings.sent1: That ratfink stole my lunch money!
meanings.sent2: Don't be a ratfink and spread rumors about others.
meanings.sent3: The ratfink tried to blame the missing cookies on the dog.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a ratfink after lying to her best friend.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie was a real ratfink, always causing trouble.

meanings.definition: To inform on someone; betray them.
meanings.sent1: I won't ratfink on my friends, even under pressure.
meanings.sent2: He decided to ratfink on his accomplices to get a lighter sentence.
meanings.sent3: The spy had to ratfink on his own team to save himself.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty after ratfinking on her sister to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent5: Ratfinking on your colleagues is never a good idea in the workplace.
